intro: Uncinia breviculmis, commonly known as the short-stalked hookweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in clusters at the base of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of streams. Due to its delicate structure and preference for wet environments, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
